results.title: Foresters Island
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and Rodney Musch
results.brief_description: Portrays the development of the timber resources of Tasmania from the earliest settlement of the State through to the present day large-scale timber operations and the management of the resource by the State Forestry Commission.

results.title: Foresters
results.brief_description: There has been greater progress in the science of forestry during the past several decades than in any previous time, and it is the practitioner of the trade, the professional forester, whose day-to-day work is most responsible for making effective the discoveries, experiments and research carried on at forestry stations across Canada. This film shows both the modern technology of the timberlands and the role of the forester in the preservation and regeneration of this great natural resource.

results.title: Forest without spears
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Lionel Hudson
results.brief_description: The Bulolo Valley in New Guinea was once a mere hunting ground; now it is the home of the Commonwealth New Guinea Timbers, a company cutting 10 million square feet of Klinki pine a year. Compares pre-war mining operations by dredge and the forestry industry of today; the milling operations, growing seedling trees, felling mature ones; transport; transformation into the finished product; importance to the people of the area of the industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Lionel Hudson

results.title: Forest under siege
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Colin Low
results.brief_description: Two million six hundred square kilometres of forest are the feeding-grounds of armies of insects. This film shows the devastation, its causes, and the many ways in which the Canadian Forestry Service, with the help of the provincial governments, is fighting this vast attack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Colin Low

results.title: Forest treasures
results.creator_credit: A-B Svensk Filmindustri and Gunnar Skoglund
results.brief_description: Documentary about logging 250 year-old trees in Sweden and their journey by river and road to the mills. Some are made into planks, other timber is pulped. This pulp is processed into newsprint and paper but some is made into viscose and ends up as manmade silk and rayon. Sweden was a leader in this technique.

results.title: Forest to foundry
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Norman A. Uren
results.brief_description: Wundowie, Western Australia is known for its sawmills and its pig-iron foundry. It is in the midst of the jarrah country and two sawmills produce high grade timber. Iron ore is brought to Wundowie from the quarries and there reduced to pig-iron in blast furnaces with the charcoal produced from the timber waste.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Norman A. Uren

results.title: Forest murmurs
results.brief_description: Presents the beauty of a public park, a bubbling brook, sparkling water, and verdant growth. But gradually bits of paper, tin cans, and broken bottles, bring discord. A plea against litter in public parks and forests.

results.title: Forest heritage
results.creator_credit: Esso Oil Company, Andrew Rice and Roy Layzell
results.brief_description: The film gives a picture of life in the New Forest in Hampshire, featuring the ponies, the ancient customs and historical remains of the Forest, and the work of the Forestry Commission.

results.title: Forest harvesting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
This film shows how new machines present an exciting prospect of significantly improving the economics of forestry operations.
